Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course

Comments_List: 8 hour/week total
8 hours per week
About 8 hours
8 hours per week

Strengths- passion and commitment of preceptors
Weaknesses- did not have preplanned projects

Overall, I thought it was a good opportunity to learn about multiple aspects of the healthcare industry in more detail. Ways it could be improved include more review frequent review sessions or more explanations of exam content during the lectures.
It was hard to get started in the beginning.
The experience with the practicum was largely dependent on where the student was placed, but the amount of general support from the check-ins were appreciated.

Good practical experience. Was more useful for understanding an organization than for actually learning new skills. 

If you have multiple students at the same place, please be careful about not having one mentor the other. At times, it felt like I was being asked to mentor my colleague, which both put me in an awkward position and took time away from what I wanted to learn in my limited time.

Overall, an amazing experience however! Glad to have done it!

Very structured, great learning/shadowing opportunities
Supportive team members
Extremely rewarding experience

strengths: good way to get experience out of class with good support from professor
weakness: need funding to take care of expenses incurred from practicum

I really enjoyed my experience at Smilow. I think it is not very practical though to expect one final deliverable given that our schedules and that of our preceptor/ team typically do not match up, and things tend to frequently change.
Very practical. May want to communicate with organizations to allow heavier responsibility for students.

Strength: Great way to get work experience

Weaknesses: time constraint

The course is what you make of it - the instructor (Marty Klein) is very approachable and easy to reach, so you have plenty of room to communicate with him regarding issues that may arise, or any questions you have about your specific practicum.
Not super helpful for those already doing clinical work. Would prefer the practicum requirement be waived for those students.

Strength: great hands-on learning experience for healthcare management students
Weakness: depending on the site and the preceptor, some practicums lack the structure and support for students to really learn and contribute

The biggest strength of the course was getting practical experience to back up the more academic classes taken throughout the program.
The biggest weakness of the course was the travel involved and the time spent getting to and from the practicum.

Professor Klein is passionate and did an excellent job of finding practicums and placing students. Occasionally he was forgetful with details which is understandable given his scope of responsibilities.
Howie is a great instructor and his lectures were engaging overall.
Very involved and attentive to students needs.
Great supporter throughout. Very willing to hear feedback and improve our practicum experiences.

Very encouraging and helpful 
Sometimes the organization of class assignments was unclear and there was confusion when/where/how everything needed to be completed
Great!
Dr. Klein is very receptive to his students' concerns and is quick to respond.
Good

Strengths: Very responsive and helpful

Weaknesses: N/A
Felt that he was accessible throughout the whole semester, and felt that he was very supportive of all students participating in the practicum.
Dr. Klein is extremely helpful and definitely cares a lot about students' success. He has been a great support system this semester.
Easy to make appointments with Dr. Klein when you have questions.
Varies greatly based on placement- if you are passionate about your topic and if it is relevant to your career path then I would definitely recommend it.
Great for someone without much exposure to the professional world, but be selective about the practicum placement
Experience working for a health care system in a practical setting

Very great way to gain hands-on experience in a healthcare field of interest! You are matched with a project that you are interested in, and its a wonderful opportunity to apply class concepts to real world experiences.
Very useful if willing to spend the requirement of at least 7 hours per week. Yes, I would recommend.
If you are a policy student, do the policy practicum with Shelley instead. Much better course layout!
A good way to gain practical hands on experience in healthcare. Recommend it to students who have limited work experience

Great way to basically do a healthcare management internship in the local CT/NY/MA area during the semester and earn class credit. Would recommend, especially for students with minimal work experience.
I would highly recommend this course to any student that has not had a significant amount of work experience.
